meanings.definition: To impress forcefully, especially so as to make oblivious to faults or shortcomings.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks never fail to bedazzle the audience.
meanings.sent2: The fireworks display bedazzled everyone with its bright colors and loud bangs.
meanings.sent3: The clown tried to bedazzle the grumpy cat with a silly dance.
meanings.sent4: Her radiant smile could bedazzle even the darkest of moods.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling diamond ring seemed to bedazzle all who laid eyes on it.

meanings.definition: To dazzle or impress with brilliance.
meanings.sent1: The sun's rays bedazzled the dewdrops on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The elaborate costume design bedazzled the audience at the fashion show.
meanings.sent3: The disco ball bedazzled the dance floor with its shimmering reflections.
meanings.sent4: The city lights at night bedazzle the skyline with their twinkling glow.
meanings.sent5: The star-studded sky never fails to bedazzle me with its beauty.
